sentences.sContent: The phone rang, but she ignored it.
sentences.sCn: 电话铃响了，但她只当没听见。
萨姆粗鲁地对这个问题不予理睬。

sentences.sContent: ...one could no longer ignore the division that had come to define the American economic landscape...
...Saying they can no longer ignore the rising prices of health care...

...I'm hoping to get a better grip on some of the questions raised by the data revolution: In what situations should we rely on intuitive pattern recognition and in which situations should we ignore intuition and follow the data...

...They practically beg a user to ignore the long-suffering professor struggling to pass on accumulated wisdom from the front of the room - a prospect that teachers find most irritating and students view as...
...One is that the men who dominate corporate boards are hopelessly sexist: they promote people like themselves and ignore any female talent...
...To classify parenting as a personal choice for which there is no collective responsibility is not merely to ignore the social benefits of good parenting; really...

remMethod.val: ig ＋ nore(看作nose， 鼻子) → 翘起鼻子不理睬 → 不顾， 不理

words.tran: 忽略；不顾（ignore的过去分词）；不理会

trans.tranOther: to behave as if you had not heard or seen someone or something
